intro: Tagetes laxa, commonly known as the Mexican marigold or the desert marigold, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant characterized by its yellow or orange flowers and feathery, aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny environments and is well adapted to arid conditions. Its flowers bloom in the summer months and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Tagetes laxa is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
